dyslexia.title: Understanding Dyslexia
dyslexia.description: Dyslexia is a learning disorder that involves difficulty reading due to problems identifying speech sounds and learning how they relate to letters and words.
tips: Use multisensory teaching methods (visual, auditory, kinesthetic)
Break text into smaller, manageable chunks
Use colored overlays or tinted backgrounds
Allow extra time for reading tasks
Use audiobooks alongside written text
Practice phonemic awareness exercises
Use fonts designed for dyslexia (OpenDyslexic)
Encourage reading aloud and repeated reading

resources.title: Phonics Games
resources.description: Interactive games to improve letter-sound recognition

dysgraphia.title: Understanding Dysgraphia
dysgraphia.description: Dysgraphia is a learning disability that affects writing abilities, including handwriting, typing, and spelling.
tips: Use wide-ruled paper and larger pencils
Allow typing as an alternative to handwriting
Practice letter formation with different materials
Use graphic organizers for writing assignments
Break writing tasks into smaller steps
Allow verbal responses when appropriate
Use speech-to-text technology
Practice fine motor skills exercises

dyscalculia.title: Understanding Dyscalculia
dyscalculia.description: Dyscalculia is a learning disability that affects a person's ability to understand numbers and learn math facts.
tips: Use manipulatives (blocks, counters, beads)
Connect math to real-life situations
Use visual representations of math concepts
Break problems into smaller steps
Allow use of calculators for complex calculations
Practice estimation skills
Use games to make math fun
Create math fact reference sheets
